intro: Dicliptera magaliesbergensis, commonly known as the Magaliesberg daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with white rays and a yellow disk. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and is adapted to dry, sandy soils. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers that bloom in spring. Dicliptera magaliesbergensis is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
